intro: Aregelia leucophaea, commonly known as the white-leaved aregelia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its glossy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are clustered in umbels, adding ornamental value to gardens. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
